template.name: Huawei 10K UPS
template.description:
## Overview
This template for **Huawei UPS 2000**
Protocol SNMP v2
Items 95 with low discovery
**Triggers**:
Battery charge < {$BATTERY\_CHARGE}% on {HOST.NAME}
Battery backup time < {$BACKUP\_TIME} on {HOST.NAME}
Battery is discharging on {HOST.NAME}
**Macros****:**
{$BACKUP\_TIME} - Remaining critical battery life in minutes
{$BATTERY\_CHARGE} - The critical battery percentage
Template on my [GitHub](https://github.com/pgalonza/Notes/blob/master/administration/zabbix/templates/Template%20Huawei%2010K%20UPS.xml) repository
MIBs on my [GitHub](https://github.com/pgalonza/Notes/tree/master/administration/huawei/ups2000/snmp) repository
## Author
P.V. Galonza

item.name: Number of active alarms
item.description: Number of active alarms, ranging from 0 to 8000.

item.name: Alarm synchronization ID
item.description: Alarm synchronization ID. The value ranges from 0 to 4294967295. This value is used by the NetEco to obtain the active alarm synchronization ID and synchronize alarms.

item.name: Ambient humidity
item.description: Ambient humidity. An integer ranging from 0 to 100. The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is %.

item.name: Ambient temperature.
item.description: Ambient temperature. An integer ranging from -50 to 120. The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is °C.

item.name: Number of parallel systems
item.description: Number of parallel systems. An integer ranging from 0 to 63.

item.name: Site time UTC
item.description: UTC time, ranging from 0 to 4294967295. The unit is seconds.

item.name: Number of devices in the system
item.description: Number of devices in the system. An integer ranging from 0 to 63.

item.name: System interface protocol version
item.description: Version number of the system interface protocol between the NetEco and NEs. A string of characters.

item.name: System main device ESN
item.description: ESN of the master device used for setting up a NetEco model. A string of characters.

item.name: System type
item.description: Name of the UPS system. A string of characters. Configurable.

discovery_rule.name: Device
discovery_rule.description: Rack ID, ranging from 1 to 100. This node is referenced as an index node by hwUpsDeviceIdentTable, hwUpsDeviceOperInfoTable, hwUpsInputTable, and hwUpsBattScheduleTestTable.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery auto test
item_prototype.description: Scheduled shallow discharge test enabled or disabled. Enumeration value. The value 1 indicates that the test is disabled. The value 2 indicates that the test is enabled.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery auto test discharge rate
item_prototype.description: Shallow discharge test discharge ratio. An integer ranging from 10 to 50.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery maximum discharge time
item_prototype.description: Maximum battery discharge time. An integer ranging from 160 to 195. The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is V/Cell.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery auto test time interval
item_prototype.description: Scheduled shallow discharge test interval. An integer ranging from 30 to 90. The unit is days.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery auto test time limit
item_prototype.description: Scheduled shallow discharge test time. Enumeration value. Value 1 indicates 00:00 to 06:00. Value 2 indicates 06:00 to 12:00. Value 3 indicates 12:00 to 18:00. Value 4 indicates 18:00 to 00:00.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery backup time
item_prototype.description: Battery Backup Time. Value range: 0 to 172800, Unit: S, and the value is an integer.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery capacity left
item_prototype.description: Battery Capacity Left. Value range: 0 to 100, Unit: %, and the value is an integer.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery current
item_prototype.description: Battery Total Current. It is a real-time analog parameter. Value range: -60000 to 60000, Unit: A, and the value is accurate to one decimal place (.1).

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery row status
item_prototype.description: RowStatus of UPS battery information table.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery temperature
item_prototype.description: Battery temperature.Value range: -20 to 80, Unit:°C, and the value is accurate to one decimal place (.1).

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery voltage
item_prototype.description: Battery Voltage. It is a real-time analog parameter. Value range: 0 to 20000, Unit: V, and the value is accurate to one decimal place (.1).

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery schedule rest row status
item_prototype.description: RowStatus of UPS Battery control table.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery test
item_prototype.description: If you set the value to shallowDsgTest(4), you can perform a shallow discharge test; if you set the value to verifyDsgTest(5), you can perform a capacity test; if you set the value to stopTest(2), you can stop the test. Other settings are invalid. If you start a test when other tests are in progress, error code 4 is returned. During test, you can use this node to obtain the current or previous test type. If you have never started the battery test sheduleTest(3), shallowDsgTest(4), or verifyDsgTest(5), this node returns noTestInit(1).

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} bypass input frequency
item_prototype.description: Bypass input frequency. The value ranges from 0 to 10000 The value is accurate to two decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is Hz.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} bypass input voltage phase A
item_prototype.description: Bypass input voltage phase A. The value ranges from 0 to 10000 The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is V

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} bypass input voltage phase B
item_prototype.description: Bypass input voltage phase B. The value ranges from 0 to 10000 The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is V

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} bypass input voltage phase C
item_prototype.description: Bypass input voltage phase C. The value ranges from 0 to 10000 The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is V

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} bypass row status
item_prototype.description: RowStatus of UPS bypass information table.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery end test
item_prototype.description: Battery End Test,Enumeration type. Value 1 indicates enabled. Value 2 indicates unknown

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery manual boost charge
item_prototype.description: Battery Manual to Boost Charge,Enumeration type. Value 1 indicates enabled. Value 2 indicates disabled.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery manual float charge
item_prototype.description: Battery Manual to Float Charge,Enumeration type. Value 1 indicates enabled. Value 2 indicates unknown

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery shallow test
item_prototype.description: Battery Shallow Test,Enumeration type. Value 1 indicates enabled. Value 2 indicates unknown

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery stop test state
item_prototype.description: Battery Stop Test State,Enumeration type. Value 1 indicates enabled. Value 2 indicates disabled.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery to boost state
item_prototype.description: Battery Change to Boost Charge State,Enumeration type. Value 1 indicates enabled. Value 2 indicates disabled.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery to float state
item_prototype.description: Battery Change to Float Charge State,Enumeration type. Value 1 indicates enabled. Value 2 indicates disabled.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery to test state
item_prototype.description: Battery Change to Test State,Enumeration type. Value 1 indicates enabled. Value 2 indicates disabled.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery verify cap test
item_prototype.description: Battery Verify Cap Test,Enumeration type. Value 1 indicates enabled. Value 2 indicates unknown

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} ECO switch
item_prototype.description: ECO settings. Enumeration type. The default value is 1. Value 1 indicates ECO mode. Value 2 indicates Non ECO mode.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} EPO
item_prototype.description: EPO. Enumeration type. Value 1 indicates EPO . Value 255 indicates invalid.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} input standard
item_prototype.description: Input Standard,Enumeration type. Value 1 indicates single phase. Value 2 indicates three phase.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} model capacity
item_prototype.description: Model Capacity.The value ranges from 0 to 200, The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is kVA.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} model Type
item_prototype.description: Model type,Enumeration type. Value 17 indicates 6K. Value 33 indicates 10K. Value 65 indicates 20K.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} output standard
item_prototype.description: Output Standard,Enumeration type. Value 1 indicates single phase. Value 2 indicates three phase.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} power off
item_prototype.description: Power off settings. Enumeration type. Value 1 indicates power off . Value 2 indicates unknow.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} power on
item_prototype.description: Power on settings. Enumeration type. Value 1 indicates power on . Value 2 indicates unknow.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} power on state
item_prototype.description: Power On State,Enumeration type. Value 1 indicates power off. Value 2 indicates booting. Value 3 indicates failed to power on. Value 4 indicates succeed tp power on.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} row status
item_prototype.description: RowStatus of UPS rack control table

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} battery status
item_prototype.description: Battery status. Enumeration type. Value 1 indicates that no battery is connected. Value 2 indicates that the battery is not charging or discharging. Value 3 indicates hibernation. Value 4 indicates float charging. Value 5 indicates equalized charging. Value 6 indicates discharging.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} current flow status
item_prototype.description: Current flow status. An integer ranging from 0 to 70000.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} ESN
item_prototype.description: ESN. A string of characters.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} row status
item_prototype.description: RowStatus of UPS device Identification table.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} interface protocol
item_prototype.description: Interface protocol version number for the current device. A string of characters.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} running row status
item_prototype.description: RowStatus of UPS device running information table.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} parallel ID
item_prototype.description: ID of the parallel system that the current device belongs to. An integer ranging from 0 to 63.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} power rating
item_prototype.description: System capacity. Enumeration type. The default value is 5. The unit is kVA. Value 1 indicates 80 kVA Value 2 indicates 100 kVA. Value 3 indicates 120 kVA. Value 4 indicates 160 kVA. Value 5 indicates 200 kVA.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} power supply mode
item_prototype.description: Device power supply mode. Enumeration type. Value 1 indicates no power supply. Value 2 indicates bypass mode. Value 3 indicates normal mode. Value 4 indicates battery mode. Value 5 indicates combined mode. Value 6 indicates mains ECO mode. Value 7 indicates battery ECO mode.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} redundant number
item_prototype.description: Redundant number of the parallel system. An integer ranging from 0 to 3.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} soft version number
item_prototype.description: Device software version number. A string of characters.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} temperature
item_prototype.description: Maximum temperature of the modules in the current device. An integer ranging from 0 to 300.

item_prototype.name: Device model with ID {#HWUPSDEVICEID}
item_prototype.description: Device model. A string of characters.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} input frequency
item_prototype.description: Input frequency. The value ranges from 0 to 10000. The value is accurate to two decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is Hz.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} input row status
item_prototype.description: RowStatus of UPS input information table.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} input voltage phase A
item_prototype.description: Input voltage phase A. The value ranges from 0 to 10000. The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is V.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} input voltage phase B
item_prototype.description: Input voltage phase B. The value ranges from 0 to 10000. The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is V.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} input voltage phase C
item_prototype.description: Input voltage phase C. The value ranges from 0 to 10000. The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is V.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} output active power phase A
item_prototype.description: Rack phase A output active power. The value ranges from -12000 to 12000. The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is kW.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} output active power phase B
item_prototype.description: Rack phase B output active power. The value ranges from -12000 to 12000. The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is kW.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} output active power phase C
item_prototype.description: Rack phase C output active power. The value ranges from -12000 to 12000. The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is kW.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} output appearance power phase A
item_prototype.description: Rack phase A output apparent power. The value ranges from -12000 to 12000. The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is kVA.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} output appearance power phase B
item_prototype.description: Rack phase B output apparent power. The value ranges from -12000 to 12000. The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is kVA.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} output appearance power phase C
item_prototype.description: Rack phase C output apparent power. The value ranges from -12000 to 12000. The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is kVA.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} output current phase A
item_prototype.description: Rack phase A output current. The value ranges from 0 to 10000. The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is A.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} output current phase B
item_prototype.description: Rack phase B output current. The value ranges from 0 to 10000. The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is A.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} output current phase C
item_prototype.description: Rack phase C output current. The value ranges from 0 to 10000. The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is A.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} output frequency
item_prototype.description: Rack output frequency. The value ranges from 0 to 10000. The value is accurate to two decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is Hz.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} output load phase A
item_prototype.description: Rack phase A output load ratio. The value ranges from 0 to 5000 The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} output load phase B
item_prototype.description: Rack phase B output load ratio. The value ranges from 0 to 5000 The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} output load phase C
item_prototype.description: Rack phase C output load ratio. The value ranges from 0 to 5000 The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} output row status
item_prototype.description: RowStatus of UPS output information table.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} output voltage phase A
item_prototype.description: Rack phase A output voltage. The value ranges from 0 to 10000. The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is V.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} output voltage phase B
item_prototype.description: Rack phase B output voltage. The value ranges from 0 to 10000. The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is V.

item_prototype.name: {#HWUPSDEVICETYPE}-{#HWUPSDEVICEID} output voltage phase C
item_prototype.description: Rack phase C output voltage. The value ranges from 0 to 10000. The value is accurate to one decimal place on the NetEco. The unit is V.
